document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic revision of Scopocira Simon, 1900 (Araneae: Salticidae)

Scopocira histrio
Simon, 1900
: 386
(Male holotype from Pará, Brazil , deposited in MNHN , examined).

: 444
, fig. 499 .
Galiano, 1963
: 439
, pl. XXXVI, figs 7‒9 ; World Spider Catalog, 2014 .

Grauhara vivida
Peckham & Peckham, 1901
: 226
, pl. 2 , fig. 2 (Male holotype from Santarém, Pará, Brazil , deposited in
MCZ 23517
, examined).
NEW SYNONYMY .

Scopocira vivida :
Simon, 1903
: 1049
; World Spider Catalog, 2014 .

Suaruna delicata
Mello-Leitão, 1945
: 298
, fig. 91 (Female holotype from Puerto Victoria, Misiones, Argentina , deposited in Museo de La Plata, not examined). Synonymized by
Galiano, 1963
: 440
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 123–128.
S. bicornia
sp. nov. 123 male, dorsal view; 124 left male palp, ventral view; 125 same, retrolateral view; 126 female, dorsal view; 127 epigyne, ventral view; 128 same, cleared, dorsal view. Scale bar=1 mm (123, 126); 0.25 mm (124–125, 127–128).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Note. Although we have not examined the female holotype of
Suaruna delicata
, the illustrations made by Galiano of a female compared to the type ( 1958 , figs 2 A‒C) agree with the description of
S. histrio
.

tr.th: left male palp, ventral view; 131 same,

tr.td: cleared, dorsal view. Scale bar=1 mm

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis . Males of
S. histrio
(
Fig. 97
) are similar to those of
S. carinata
(
Fig. 85
) by the developed, granular ITA, but can be recognized by the poorly developed paraembolic projection (
Fig. 96
). Females of this species (Fig. 159 ) are similar to those of
S. dentichelis
(
Fig. 111
) by the general color pattern, but can be recognized by the smooth lateral fields of the epigynal plate (Fig. 160 ) (excavated in
S. dentichelis
,
Fig. 115
).

Description .
Male ( MPEG 15966 ).
Total length: 4.31 . Carapace dark brown, 2.02 long, 0.98 wide, 0.63 high (Fig. 156 ). Ocular quadrangle lighter, with two transverse dark brown stripes, 0.87 long, bordered by a posterior line of white scales. Anterior eye row 0.98 wide and posterior 0.88 wide. Palp light brown (Figs 157‒158 ); RTA elongated, RvTA short and rounded, ITA developed and granulated; paraembolic projection rectangular with striae, acute tip of DEA seen on the retrolateral side; embolus stout and short, oblique. Legs 1432 , I dark brown, II‒IV yellow. Length of femur: I 1.82 , II 1.02 , III 0.98 , IV 1.32 ; patella + tibia: I 2.44 , II 1.28 , III 1.18 , IV 1.61 ; metatarsus + tarsus: I 1.61 , II 1.01 , III 1.06 , IV 1.48 . Spination on ventral tibia I: 2 - 2 - 2 - 2 . Abdomen dorsally with complex color pattern (Fig. 156 ); ventrally cream-colored.

Female ( MPEG 4077 ).
Total length: 3.14 . Carapace 1.38 long, 0.98 wide, 0.69 high, as in male (Fig. 159 ). Ocular quadrangle 0.89 long. Anterior eye row 0.98 wide and posterior 0.92 wide. Legs 4132 , yellow. Length of femur: I 0.80 , II 0.68 , III 0.66 , IV 0.86 ; patella + tibia: I 1.13 , II 0.77 , III 0.75 , IV 1.13 ; metatarsus + tarsus: I 0.81 , II 0.67 , III 0.78 , IV 1.02 . Spination and abdomen as in male. Epigyne as in Figs 160‒161 .
